Differential Privacy Rust Python Open Source Statistics

Context

In many organizations, data plays a central role in research and decision-making. However, analyzing data that contains individual information creates serious privacy risks. Differential Privacy (DP) addresses this by adding calibrated statistical noise, ensuring that an individual's presence does not meaningfully change results.

The OpenDP Library is a collaborative project providing tools for government and academia to produce private analyses. Built in Rust for performance and Python for accessibility, it bridges the gap between theoretical research and real-world software engineering.

Key Objectives

1. Privacy Auditing

Adapt and integrate a novel auditing framework to empirically estimate privacy leakage and benchmark mechanisms against theoretical bounds.

2. Research & Theory
  • Advanced Composition: Implement adaptive composition for zCDP/RDP.
  • Hypothesis Testing: Develop DP statistics for difference of means and independence tests.
  • Benchmarking: Explore utility trade-offs in regression models.
3. Engineering & Integration
  • Mechanism Implementation: Primitive mechanisms like truncated noise and interval exponential.
  • Polars Integration: Enhance the high-performance integration with the Polars DataFrame library.
